Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with alternating added red and black tongues outlined in white between red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of warrior tó left in short black chiton, flesh coloured upper thighs and carrying shield (red rim of shield with rows of white and brown dots; eye device on white background with the white of the eye in light brown, dark brownish iris and black pupil).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Naukratis Painter. The painter and the group are named after a chalice found at Naukratis and the slip on all vessels from this group is a light beige to almost creamy white. Rim patterns are very simple and there is no filling ornament. The depiction of figures, however, is very elaborate. Clothing is rendered highly decorated and naked skin is expertly portrayed.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 111, p. 276, no. 736, pl. III, pl. 96)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 86)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0795) (phase 2)
